lead_paragraph: A lot of healthy people are defying predictions by the Affordable Care Act architects and refusing to enroll, throwing off the math behind the system.

headline.print_headline: Many Prefer Tax Penalties to Health Law
headline.main: Health Law Tax Penalty? I’ll Take It, Millions Say

snippet: A lot of healthy people are defying predictions by the Affordable Care Act architects and refusing to enroll, throwing off the math behind the system....
abstract: Tax penalty implemented by Affordable Care Act that is levied on Americans who opt to forego insurance has proved to be insufficient incentive for many people, which is in some part why premiums on some of health law's insurance exchanges are expected to rise significantly; penalty has been slowly increasing each year, and will be about $700 or more in 2017, but Obama administration has been cautious about enforcing fine as it is most unpopular aspect of law.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
